BB3E23EAAAE34A00A6D7FB4114F2CB03.description: Prayers from fifth grade (See PRAYERS table).

99BAA8C5070147D3A3728D4F963DE0D8.description: Identify the elements of the Lord's Prayer.

9300421063FA4CFD9B4B117817D4AF85.description: Analyze the deepening awareness of the covenanted relationship with God that prayer provides.

51BFB4B9E7E6486ABF583025BAA6E785.description:
Recognize the Eucharistic Liturgy as the community's central act of
worship.

E649640432D64D148ABFBA6D7D541E4B.description: Affirm that worship belongs to God alone.

9A74033CA20F478B8F25C69EC2AA2A84.description: Identify psalms as prayers that Jesus liked to pray. {CCC:2585, 2597)

E518B5E7168249669E1B617FBE3BF8DE.description: Catholic Tradition of Prayer - Know and participate in the Catholic tradition of prayer.

E0FAFDCC89E1412E9F8ED2A7472D4770.description: Demonstrate the ca!! to be faithful to God's love.

46D697077E0C4EF99ED5D0AF237CB0A3.description: Recognize that God sends prophets to call us to justice and mercy.

968500B5B560427EB2EF8074410CCE16.description: Describe how_!~ ljl{~ go(Jd ljves as taught in the_Scrlptures.

A8C2091A24B34681AA9C17D4F1D5D900.description: Recognize our heritage of faith from those who have gone before us. (CCC: 147, 1957)

E24D5ACCD540445DB76F838861AE2683.description:
Indicate that the Holy Spirit and the Church help us choose what is
right {CCC: 733-736, 2246)

8025F43893D04711A27C19127C367CD4.description: Moral Conscience - Develop a moral conscience informed by Church teachings.

B1CDC14A878F481DA47AB5F638BBEC61.description:
Recall that the corpora! and spiritual works of mercy show our love for
Jesus. {CCC: 2447)

71C34FD926E146B181B3D48559930F2D.description: Illustrate how caring for others means considering their needs (CCC:1932, 1937)

43F9A5BF57DC4758A0FB994B6BF06C55.description:
Explain that the Church teaches us to reach out to those who suffer,
especially the poor and needy. (CCC:1929-35)

45E07A3CC4F541F2B0D839F94F047E67.description:
Recognize Jesus as the center of God's plan for the world. (CCC: 430-
431)

7BF0EA6B368E468286782826536F6128.description:
Community Service - Engage in service to the community (e.g., family, parish, local,
national and global) in response to the Gospel call.

947765E0556F42C0B4552FC34A0E848C.description:
Recognize the way to the reign of God through justice and peace.
(CCC 2238-43, 2442)

3073B7A15B72433EB2C3BD67E9162E28.description:
Examine the prophets regarding the mysteries of life: suffering,
injustice, and death. (CCC: 164-165)

FA42B3A825544233AA074414B6006BE7.description: Demonstrate how our God is a God of freedom. (CCC: 387, 1731-34)

047BAECC1EA144F2BED235C728EF1656.description:
Social Justice - Know, critique and apply social justice principles to personal and
societal situations.

AC8F3EAB37FA4FEB89DE628046F9B01D.description: Recognize that we are called to a chaste life. (C~C: 2349)

A99ADDAB3D364452B32C4FDEF5D2EEEB.description:
Defend human sexuality as a precious gift of God. {CCC: 2332-33,
2353)

015746791E014812990D079927D2D4DE.description:
Analyze the Scriptures as a guide in moral pathways to the reign of
God. (CCC: 2521)

98D1064134E2452F8BC9ECB515D74451.description:
Recognize that God's Spirit calls people to conversion and faithfulness.
(CCC: 1430)

8AD4BB7E60C0473EBD83BB98B35D94C8.description: Demonstrate how we are God's people by living the commandments, (CCC 2072)

7C950E9B58C74E9197B1291CAA6D6E0C.description: Human Sexuality - Apply Catholic principles to interpersonal relations.

C329B1737AEA40B09F4F5291AF358230.description: Analyze how discrimination and prejudice lead to injustice.

A23117D3DC6F468D912631E12A1FE4A6.description: Recognize life as sacred from conception to death.

7437097EADAE43A5A0AB408DB21164EA.description:
Identify significant contributions to the Church by varied ethnic
cultures. (CCC 2213)

19BA49FC1E254D0FB97F270056D942F4.description:
Tel! that we are children of the covenant God made with Abraham
and Sarah. iccc 2571)

3789E2FC34B2442E8D6624E4E9EC1614.description:
Human Dignity - Acknowledge and affirm the dignity of the human person and
community.

0601A091947F4D929C9BF5966BE2DD8A.description: Examine the role of the laity in the Church.

3C2EE78EFCA7471CAE42DC01C7881801.description: Examine the role of consecrated life in the Church.

060D45EF58E944A7A6A166835DBC273E.description: Identify the uniqueness of the priesthood.

D97573F4B5AC4A5EB7E15A901B375646.description:
Identify Christian vocations that reflect our Baptismal call to
discipleship.

6CD4170140A64DBBB05B9493A35FF980.description:
Relate how Christians are to be missionaries bringing Good News to
the ends of the earth. {CCC: 571, 854)

8D81E321B0B5409EAF370943A691FB99.description:
Vocations - Recognize the call ta serve God's people through the ordained
ministries of Holy Orders. {CCC: 1581}

9A2E874C21004FDE93226FA8F82BC3B6.description:
Know that the Sacraments of Initiation are Baptism, Confirmation,
and Eucharist; Sacraments of Healing are Penance and Reconciliation
and Anointing of the Sick; Sacraments of Vocation/Service are Holy
Orders and Matrimony. (CCC:1212, 1421, 1534-35)

4334C750CB7045BA86D8964D93FDBDE7.description: Attend and participate in Sunday Mass regularly. (CCC:2180-83)

0ACB5AE6514943ACA04C779B7F1F430C.description:
Recognize the call to serve God's people through the ordained
ministries of Holy Orders. (CCC: 1536-38)

36876F2478AA41E8BFD3E5B8C302A918.description:
Discuss the sacrament of matrimony, the grace-filled covenant
between man and woman. (CCC:1639)

A38BA59EAC2C4081BF330D6C96E27D8D.description:
Witness Christ's healing presence in our lives through the sacrament
of anointing of the sick. {CCC:1520-1524)

6C7A441D0D6E4DC18C8CB01FC92EB17D.description:
Recognize and celebrate Sunday as the lord's day by regular
participation in Sunday and Holy Days of Obligation liturgy. (CCC:
1166-71, 2192-93)

56FB22B95F344119BABFACC832794E5E.description:
Examine how the sacred is experienced in the liturgical year,
sacramental symbols, and rituals. (CCC: 1124, 1667~70, 2720)

14779C8C1F504862B0C1A9D4778C0FEA.description:
Recall that sacramental actions of the Church originated in Jewish
rituals. {CCC: 1096)

2F10D48D83A84268B1E30725B194D012.description:
Tell how Baptism calls us to new life, cleanses sin, and joins us to the
Christian community. {CCC: 1257, 1275)

3DB87CE9263642078B81F0B9BDF01FD9.description:
Recognize the grace of God through the special gifts and symbolic
actions of the sacraments. (CCC: 1129}

461928DD63D14491B1A6C17597205F7E.description:
Celebrate Eucharist, which symbolizes the reign of God, brings us
peace, and reconciles us. (CCC: 1322, 1415)

D70518B89E0E4B37A084A9BD264F1BAA.description:
Sacraments - Demonstrate the importance of sacraments, with an emphasis on
the centrality of the Eucharist, in the life of Catholics.

1B899811C8E44098A6EEB9A15FF1D5E5.description:
Engage in problem solving to promote responsible stewardship of
God's creation. (CCC: 2258, 2415)

15B6CB3A64C2419EAC64C6FA6EDB31C2.description:
Recognize that Christians are called to overcome evil and to be
responsible stewards. (CCC: 2401-2402, 2406, 2450-2451)

E8B2E7DC9BB54908B818BF94D5FBCCB7.description: Identify ways in which sin can destroy God's creation. (CCC: 1863)

A8AD4871FC6147B4B7227947E94E9605.description: Creation - Exercise responsible stewardship for the gift of creation.

3CF25494C0044F9CA7F83DE8DAEAECA6.description:
Identify that at Mass the community is reconciled, gives thanks, and
celebrates. {CCC: 1324,2182)

21E325CA6F654CF9B2ED4F915F608316.description:
List the liturgical feasts and seasons of the church. (CCC: 1163, 1168-
69, 1171, 1194)

D5E8EEC7D0F84502831FE887B1110745.description:
Celebrate the presence and actions of Christ in our lives through the
seven sacraments. (CCC:1113-1116)

DE0837AEDEA8458891467A0BE6385908.description:
Participate in the Church as a celebrating community. (CCC:2790) Participate in various liturgies, anniversaries, holiday celebrations ln
school/parish community.

8615D8086CE048E296996386C649A12C.description:
Relate that the Church is a community of God's people called to
continual reform and renewal. {CCC: 2625)

5A55DD0018E94A82B2CE190CC9D39ACE.description:
Explain and celebrate the Pope as the leader of the Catholic Church
throughout the world. (CCC: 895)

C6C09BA73367488CAB4D397FC60BE456.description:
Community - Demonstrate an appreciation for faith community as a primary
way we come to know God.

892E4095B1D740E0BDD6B3B03CED1D90.description: We are the members of the universal Church, the diocese, and our own parish. Students should know the names of the Pope, the diocesan bishop, and pastor of their parish.

BCA1F29233DC4BD5856177A7FA6FACA2.description: Identify God within the Church, the Body of Christ. (CCC: 792-95)

01EF2DFCD0B44C84A8D307C2652F1F14.description:
Recognize the roots of the Church in the many signs and symbols of
the Hebrew Scriptures. (CCC: 696)

65D35C26113246FAB94D9126CC87D832.description: Relate that the Church was born on the feast of Pentecost. {CCC: 767)

8B923FA6FE6C4784A9D234B89A2D1D5E.description: Church - Illustrate a basic understanding of Church.

0D4D88831A8A4169BCF0DB78905F86F2.description:
Point out that the Holy Spirit is always present and active in the lives
of people. {CCC: 236)

849BD52A19B84B9EA42D291600E573CE.description:
Identify the authors of the Bible who were inspired by the Holy Spirit.
(CCC: 106)

366E2C441F194188A00B9E373BD2337F.description:
Discuss the mystery of the Holy Trinity in the person, words, and
works of Jesus Christ. (CCC: 555, 257)

2436AED468114CF9942890EDF368AC09.description: Explain that God ls revealed to us in the Bi~!~'. (C~C: 1021

3C5D180043864BDE947E50476F6458AA.description: Trinity - Recognize the Trinity as God.

3234654867E14AE6BD4578C0DC0FF753.description:
Show how Mary is honored by Catholics as the Mother of God.
(CCC: 494-95)

F3F90AA24461487DB6A6011F32E6A62C.description:
Discuss the Fall of the Angels, and their impact on our journey back to
God.(CCC 391-395)

B6CD322A2F6A4EEBA25A4DDFD51151C7.description:
Illustrate that the Holy Spirit is the breath of life and the fire of love.
(CCC, 152, 691. 696)

BC7E7CF4DBC344A5BFDF7D463F70D5DC.description:
State that Jesus is the Messiah who came to serve and liberate. (CCC:
160, 1738, 2106, 616)

8D83D0E6B3414B6FA172C887AC131819.description: Discuss how God creates out of love. (CCC: 1604, 355)

FC8B4A5898974B36AE35BE81B6CD7A26.description:
Doctrine & Dogma - Illustrate basic understanding of Catholic dogma and doctrine in
light of the creed. {CCC: 199-293)

1220F4F7A7DD4A518EEA6D210D6E2932.description:
Recall that the promise of love and partnership God made with Moses
and the Hebrew people is a covenant. (CCC: 2058-2063)

6EF7E459C0EA4516843046F2B217F8C3.description:
Trace how the Hebrew Scriptures, which contain the roots of our
faith, are fulfilled in Jesus Christ. (CCC: 133)

D0CEC78BE46249C28CBE5ABB5DEF3983.description:
Examine the experience of God's people as recorded in the Hebrew
Scriptures. {CCC: 130)

408889E8CDEC4DD1B5DA2958559DA1D2.description:
Recognize the 46 books of the Hebrew Scriptures and the 27 books of
the Christian Scriptures. (CCC: 129, 138)

CF09E1EA287C40F2B07A2BAA3BF40302.description: Scripture - Read, understand,. interpret, and apply Scripture to life.

59356EB496C344849C6AB9C97B524D4F.description: Demonstrate personal synthesis of knowledge and faith. (CCC:114)

9237E7DC59F341479000FAE9F49A10E6.description: Recognize that we are God's chosen ones. (CCC: 781)

62A0AC639EB348C7B89E0891B782D4AD.description: Relate that God sent Jesus to us for our salvation. (CCC: 70-73)

590CDB773F6D4E4F8D3FFE4CF5436D0F.description:
Use the Bible to find examples of God's goodness prevailing over sin
and evil. (CCC: 51-53)

CD0D6616A9E04EDB8FAC04981E9944A1.description:
Faith - Present an understanding of the human need for God based on
revelation and faith.
